Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sickingerhof, Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Kim M
Reviews.Content: Good last minute choice, but not for long stay. 3 bed ensuite is tight. Free internet - need password. Good breakfast. Decent location if you need something close to TXL (but TXL is closing down next year.) 30 Euro for double bed ensuite (two single beds with private toilet and shower) - breakfast included. A little high, in my opinion, but still ok. Linens and towels included. They even left a bar of soap with the towels, which was nice - not usually given to you - by what is typically considered a hostel, not a hotel. However, it is located right on the street corner, so it can be noisy. No parking available. If you arrive after normal business hours, it can be quite difficult to get a hold of someone in order to check in. No 'real' staff to speak of. I would only suggest staying here if it is a last minute choice/option, and you are just looking for a place to crash for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: neimi
Reviews.Content: Location was pretty good, bus to the airport and to the center stopped right behind the corner. Train station is also right next to the hotel, but the train lines stopping there won't get you to the center. Toilet and bathroom were in the corridor (a big minus), but there was a sink in the room (a little plus). There also was a TV in the room. Our room faced to the street and was awfully hot during daytime and evening. The windows could not be left open at night because of the traffic. When windows were closed, traffics noises didn't disturb, but the heath was unbearable. Service was good. Price included breakfast, which was very german (bread, eggs, different kind of meat, cheese and fruit jams, tea or coffee and juice) but not very nice for vegetarians. We still got our stomaches full and did not even ask if they would have had some kind of different breakfast for vegetarians. The food was really fresh and it was served to the tables, so this was no breakfast-buffet! The hotel was fully booked but really quiet. We only managed to get a room with two single-beds but they were easy to move next to each other so with a little muscular work we had a twin bed. ;) The room was cleaned every morning (a big plus). But place was in every way more than OK.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and kindless personal, good location:)”
Reviews.Author: Santa87
Reviews.Content: Nice place where stay, helpful and kind personal. Cosily and clean rooms. Shower and toilet is ok. Ther is all necesary for travellers, who spend time in Berline like tourists, because there you can sleep, go to shower and toilett. What else you need? If you want to all day sleep at hotel and say that there are not good, then you need to look after Hilton or Ritz Hotel:) For these prices there everything is exellent!Thanks Sickinger Hof Hotel for nice apartments and service:) If i will needed to stay in Belin one more time, I stayed at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT even think about it!”
Reviews.Author: Livdag
Reviews.Content: Possibly the worst hotel in Berlin?! Dirt Rude staff Leaking toilet seat Lots of traffic noise, 24/7 No breakfast when leaving early When we called them to cancel one night (speaking english) they hung up on us, so a german friend had to make the call instead and even then they were rude!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel in a run-down location with poor service, rude and dodgey staff”
Reviews.Author: RLond
Reviews.Content: This "hotel" was a very poor choice. Where to begin.. It's NOT good value at €60 a night. The room was absolutely nothing like what is shown in images on the website. The double room we booked was smaller than expected, with awkwardly placed furniture taking up most of the floorspace. We expected 2 beds and there was a third thrown in as if they'd run out of storage space elsewhere. The beds themselves are double mattresses that look like they were collected off a street. The tiny bathroom / toilet / shower was ok, however the shower never got beyond lukewarm and the showerhead wouldn't hold up on its own. The towels provided for showering were ridiculously small hand-towel size. Housekeeping is at the most minimal - not borthering to replace a small bar of soap throughout 4 days of our stay. I had to personally chase down the cleaner and ask for some. Apart from fixing the bed covers I doubt much cleaning was ever done. Also we tried to sleep in past midday after a big night out and kept waking up to the cleaner banging on the door, or somone making a ruckus outside our room. The room gets stuffy easily which meant keeping the window open and having to hear street traffic and noise at all hours of the day or night, so don't expect a sound sleep. The place is located on a large intersection close to a railway overpass. The breakfast included was very basic and average and was identical every morning (coffee, bread rolls, packets of jam, slices of cheese / ham / salami). The best part is being able to go across the road to a kebab shop that's open 'til late. The staff were generally apathetic and unhelpful, except one man behind reception who was an absolutely rude and opportunistic nightmare to deal with - we requested to checkout at 6pm the same day rather than 11am, and they said it was fine if we paid an extra €40, however when we came to speak to him the price suddenly jumped to 60, CASH! After a lot of arguing we managed to bring this down to 50. The location is run down and not in a nice area. It's far from all central sights. Taking a bus or train takes at least 25 minutes to reach any place of interest; a taxi ride will set you back about €15 - 20 one way! Overall our experience was terrible. Every facet of this hotel was disappointing and I wouldn't recommend ANYONE to stay here even one night. You'd have a better experience staying at a hostel!

Reviews.Title: “Very unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: krotopop
Reviews.Content: We have been treated in pretty rude way at the reception. Not that the receptionist didn't want to help us, but he didn't even want to listen. Moreover, the information on the website about the prices and services is not corresponding the reality. In short- I wouldn't recommend this place to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant staff, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: radosh517
Reviews.Content: Young couple from Serbia, stayed in Sickinger Hof for four days in January 2009 - the hotel is a great solution if you're coming to spend most of the time walking around Berlin and need a place to stash your stuff, sleep and have a shower and breakfast. The people working in the hotel are all very pleasant and helpful, and they all made our stay as comfortable as it could be. The hotel has a great traffic connection - it has TXL bus stop accross the street and a S-bahn station 50 m away. Guest entrance to the hotel is possible 24h a day. We would reccomend it for a short tourist-oriented stay in Berlin as a good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “disappointment”
Reviews.Author: LadyKira
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room with a shower - got one without. The staff said they could do nothing about it, but didn't even apologize. The room was so small that it was clautrophobic. The photos on their website don't show the reality. Breakfast was the same for the four days that I stayed there - and I mean THE SAME - not even one part of it was different. The hotel was very clean - that's the only plus.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: forensicsgirl
Reviews.Content: Since this was our 3rd trip to Berlin, we needed a room for one night. We made reservations for this hotel through the Venere website. Hotel cost was 50 Euros with an additional 5 Euros for use of the hotel parking lot. Since some of the rooms don't have bathrooms, we reserved a room with a bathroom. Furthermore, we specified late check-in between 9:00 and 10:00 PM. Upon our arrival, we discovered that our room had been given away. Our room did have a sink but no toilet. There was a community shower and toilets for both sexes. Unfortunately, the women's WC reeked of urine. However, there was plenty of soap, paper towels and toilet paper available. Our room was small and comfortable. Perfect for our short stay. Although there were only 2 of us, our room could have been used as a triple. Breakfast was simple with coffee, tea and juice available. Hotel staff was exceptionally helpful with directions. Furthermore, they didn't have a problem with us leaving our car in the hotel parking lot while we toured Berlin. Bus and S-bahn stops are half a block from the hotel. Be sure to pay for an S-bahn ticket. While riding the S-bahn, we were asked to show our tickets. The only drawbacks for this hotel were the bathrooms and the issue with our reservation. Otherwise, this hotel is fine for a short stay in Berlin.

HotelInfo.Name: Sickinger Hof
HotelInfo.Address: Beusselstrasse 44T, 10553 Berlin, Germany
